articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution of Iran.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries favorably developing day by day would grow stronger in all fields including politics, economy and culture, sincerely wishing the president and people of Iran greater successes in their work for defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country and realize its socio-economic development.

articles.title: Week of Film Show Opens to Celebrate Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Week of Film Show Opens to Celebrate Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A week of film show opened to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Documentary films on his revolutionary history and feats "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee", "Shining Star of Mt. Paektu" and "Shine, Jong Il Peak" will be screened at cinemas and cultural houses in Pyongyang and local areas. 
					
					 "We Will Follow You to the End of the Earth", "Desire", "Lifeline" and other feature films will also be shown.
					
					 The opening ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					
					 Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam made an opening address. 
					
					 He said that the immortal feats performed by Kim Jong Il serve as precious treasure for the Workers' Party of Korea, the army and people of the DPRK that can not be bartered for anything as they are advancing toward the final victory of the Songun revolutionary cause in another century of Juche, and the eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and the happiness for all ages 
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony the participants watched the documentary film "Under the Guidance of the Great Brilliant Commander" (22). 
					
					The week of film show week opened in all provinces on the same day.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Korean Art Gallery on Tuesday in celebration of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of Shining Star).
					 Displayed in the center of the exhibition is a fine art depicting Kim Jong Il standing atop Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Also on display are art pieces showing the revolutionary careers and personalities of the peerless great persons of Mt. Paektu and art pieces depicting service personnel and people of the DPRK performing shining feats in the defence of socialism and the building of a thriving country.
					
					 Among them are Korean painting "February Holiday Ahead of National Liberation", acryl paintings "Illustrious Commander, Shining Star of Mt. Paektu" and "Arms in Our Hands Guarantees the Victory of Korean revolution", oil painting "Saying That He Came to Meet His Soldiers" and jewel painting "It Dawns on the Chongchon River".
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop and other officials concerned, artists, working people and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 An opening address was made by Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture.

articles.title: February 16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded to Persons of Merit in DPRK
articles.content:
February 16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded to Persons of Merit in DPRK 
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- February 16 Science and Technology Prize was awarded to the scientific research successes conducive to building an economic giant and improving the standard of people's living and persons of merit with the approach of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The prize is the top science and technology prize in the DPRK.
					
					 The prize was awarded to scientific research successes, including industrial production and application technology of multi-nutrients for rice seedlings, tele-education system "Risang", 1 000kw heating pump and asynchronous electric locomotive.
					
					 The prize went to more than 180 scientists, technicians, teachers, and officials including Kim Il Nam, rector of Tele-education College under Kim Chaek University of Technology; Pak Son Hui, researcher at the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science under the State Academy of Sciences; and Won Ung, chief engineer of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex. 
					
					 A ceremony of awarding the prize took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.

articles.title: Russian Charge d'Affaires Gives Reception
articles.content:
Russian Charge d'Affaires Gives Reception 
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Igor Sagitov, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Russian embassy here, on Tuesday hosted a reception in honor of the Russian Day of Diplomats.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and other officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and staff members of the missions of international bodies here.

articles.title: Foodstuff Factory Goes Operational
articles.content:
Foodstuff Factory Goes Operational
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Kyonghung Foodstuff Factory was newly built and went operational with due ceremony on Tuesday. 
					 Officials and employees of the Kyonghung Guidance Bureau built its splendid building by their own efforts, automated raw material feeding and put overall production processes on a CNC, germ-free and dust-free basis thanks to the help of teachers and researchers of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering.
					
					 The updating of the factory helps successfully carry out the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il, who worked heart and soul to provide greater quantities of tasty and nutritious foodstuff to the people and consolidate the Juche character and independence of the foodstuff industry. 
					
					 A message of thanks of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was conveyed to the officials and employees of the bureau at the commissioning ceremony.
					
					  Present there were An Jong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, officials of the bureau and units under it and officials and employees of the factory.
					
					At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round the factory.

articles.title: DPRK Opens Internet Homepage "Korean Dishes"
articles.content:
DPRK Opens Internet Homepage "Korean Dishes"
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The Sojae Cooking Information Exchange Company under the Korean Association of Cooks has recently opened internet homepage "Korean Dishes", which is aimed to introduce the DPRK's food culture and the Association's activities and promote the exchange and cooperation with other countries in cookery.
					 The homepage shows various dishes, books and magazines on them and data on food culture as well as catering service establishments.
					
					 It carries photo- and video-accompanied cookeries of more than 3 000 dishes from book "Complete Collection of Korean Dishes" (10 volumes in total), divided into 10-odd sections such as staple food, traditional dishes, feast dishes and dishes for tourists.
					
					 The homepage has search functions for the convenience of users.
					
					 The Sojae Cooking Information Exchange Company is located in Rakwon-dong, Pothonggang District, Pyongyang.
					
					E-mail: kcac@star-co.net.kp  
					
					Fax: 0085023814410
					
					Tel: 0850-2-381-111-8359

articles.title: Makkoli, One of Traditional Drinks Popular in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Makkoli, One of Traditional Drinks Popular in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Some restaurants in Pyongyang, including Munsu and Ryonmot restaurants and Pyongyang Noodle House, have attracted an increasing number of citizens with makkoli (crude liquor), supplied by the Taedonggang Beer Factory.
					 In this regard, Choe Jong Ok, manager of the Munsu Restaurant, told KCNA:
					
					 Makkoli has low alcoholic contents with peculiar taste and aroma. The drink is considered to be good for prevention of digestive troubles.
					
					 Kim Song Hak, a resident living in Janggyong-dong No. 1, Sosong District, said that he usually takes Makkoli as it helps promote appetite.

articles.title: U.S. Germ Warfare Can Never Be Justified: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Germ Warfare Can Never Be Justified: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities, not content with confrontation with fellow countrymen in the north, went the lengths of shielding the germ warfare committed by the U.S. in the Korean war.
					 On February 5 they let the Channel A Broadcasting Service air that the DPRK spread a "false fiction" on the U.S. use of germ weapons and chemical weapons during the June 25 Korean war in a bid to "foster hatred for the U.S. through brainwashing education".
					
					 The monstrous crimes in which the U.S. killed many Koreans by using germ and chemical weapons on a large-scale are a wanton violation of international law and a deliberate crime aimed to exterminate the Korean nation.
					
					 Korea became a theatre of the U.S. imperialists' germ warfare and its first test ground in the Korean war due to their scenario to retrieve itself from its repeated military setbacks on the whole front of the war and further round off germ weapons in an actual war.
					
					 The U.S. forces spread by cunning methods lots of infectious disease-germ including smallpox in Pyongyang City, South and North Phyongan, Kangwon, South Hamgyong, South and North Hwanghae provinces and other areas in early December, 1950.
					
					 Infectious diseases by germs occurred in different areas in mid-December, 1950 explosively. The number of cases rapidly increased, reaching over 3,500 cases in April, 1951.
					
					 During the period the U.S. forces committed such bestial atrocities as spreading epidemic pathogens of hemorrhagic fever as well as smallpox.
					
					 At least 3 000 tests for germ weapons were made every day against POWs of the Korean People's Army at Boat 1091 led by the chief for hygiene and welfare of the "UN Command" anchoring in the waters off Wonsan on the East Sea of Korea and the waters off Koje Island in secrecy in March, 1951.
					
					 The U.S. committed the germ warfare on all areas of the northern half of Korea, entering 1952. Germ bombs were dropped over 169 areas of the northern half of Korea through a total of 804 raids, regardless of tablelands and coastal and mountainous areas, from early January to March, 1952.
					
					 The germ bombs which were dropped included lots of flies, fleas, spiders and other harmful insects with the most horrible malignant, acute and infectious disease-germs of more than 20 kinds. In May, 1952 the U.S. let hundreds of planes fly every day, one fourth of them  dropped  germ bombs and their number was nearly 480 one day.
					
					 The number of planes involved in the germ warfare of the U.S. forces and areas over which they dropped germ bombs clearly indicate that this was the first largest germ warfare in the world war history.
					
					 This was a wanton violation of the international convention on banning the use of toxic gas and germ weapons.
					
					 A POW who took part in the germ warfare of the U.S. testified to his crime on April 13, 1952 that he was forced to serve war merchants and drop germ bombs, committing grave crimes against the Korean people and the Chinese People's Volunteers, adding:
					
					 I had to obey orders as a soldier without fail and this order was issued by the imperialists in Wall Street.
					
					 A long period has passed since the ceasefire but evidence proving the U.S. germ and chemical warfare is found in different parts of the DPRK.
					
					 At least 40 explosives of various types including germ bomb with large infectious power were founded in a matter of a half year since the start of the project to reclaim Sepho tableland where a large-scale stockbreeding base is under construction.
					
					 The U.S. germ and chemical warfare can neither be distorted nor justified.
					
					 The group of traitors and colonial rabid dogs should be brought to a tribunal of history at an early date as they dare challenge the toughest offensive of the DPRK against the U.S. while shielding its germ warfare.

articles.title: U.S. Is Bound to Face Final Doom: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Is Bound to Face Final Doom: Minju Joson 
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- From the outset of the new year the U.S. president talked a lot about the DPRK's hacking at the Sony Pictures Entertainment and issued a "presidential executive order" calling for "new sanctions" against it. He unhesitatingly revealed his dangerous scenario to bring down the dignified socialist system of the DPRK. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that the U.S. denies dialogue with the DPRK and does not want stability of the situation of the Korean peninsula but still harbors a sinister intention to stifle the latter. 
					
					 The U.S. arrogant confrontation hysteria against the DPRK convinces of what it should do and which way it should choose. 
					
					 The DPRK is compelled to unlimitedly escalate its counteraction of justice as the Obama group's smear campaign ratchets up and anti-DPRK saber-rattling gains in scale and sphere under the conditions where it refuses to co-exist with the DPRK peacefully but reveals its inveterate and habitual repugnancy towards it. 
					
					 Option is not a monopoly of the U.S., and the DPRK has a legitimate right to protect its ideology and social system and dignity to stand in acute confrontation with the U.S. 
					
					 We would like to recall once again to the U.S. mind the tradition of the history that the DPRK emerged victorious while the DPRK defeated. The U.S. confrontation maniacs had better properly know that the day is drawing nearer when it will face final doom on its land due to its anachronistic policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korean Authorities' Trumpeting about "Dialogue" Hypocritical
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korean Authorities' Trumpeting about "Dialogue" Hypocritical 
Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are insisting dialogue should be opened, to begin with, terming the DPRK's crucial proposal a "precondition." This is no more than a crafty artifice to put aside the strong demand of the public at home and abroad for inter-Korean dialogue and improved relations and evade the blame for the catastrophic situation at any cost, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a commentary.
					It goes on:
					
					If dialogue and the improvement of relations are to take place between the north and the south, it is necessary to create a climate for them and one must refrain from doing any thing rattling the nerves of the other side. This is elementary common sense. 
					
					Nevertheless, the south Korean puppet group declared it would stage projected Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises from March as scheduled, claiming the DPRK's proposal is not helpful to inter-Korean dialogue.
					
					From the outset of the year the puppet war-like forces began operating the staff of south Korea-U.S. combined division whose mission is to "disable nukes and missiles of the north" and "conduct special civilian operation" and introduced an Aegis destroyer and a nuclear-propelling submarine belonging to the U.S. 7th Fleet into provocative saber-rattling.
					
					Such behavior is nothing but an undisguised revelation of their will not to create the atmosphere for dialogue between the north and the south through detente and improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					It is self-evident that dialogue and improved relations can never be expected from the puppet forces as they are pretending to "provide conditions for resuming dialogue" but getting frantic in their confrontation between social systems such as anti-DPRK leaflet scattering operation behind the scene.
					
					What the south Korean authorities truly want is to realize their sinister aim to achieve "unification of social systems" by escalating confrontation between social systems under the pretext of "dialogue."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for Shielding U.S. Germ Warfare
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for Shielding U.S. Germ Warfare
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean puppet group let loose a spate of invectives that the DPRK is spreading a "false fiction" that the U.S. used germ weapons in the Korean war and is deploying chemical weapons in Okinawa. They are claiming this propaganda is to foster "hatred for the U.S. through brainwashing for consolidating the social system".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says:
					
					 The U.S. had denied its germ warfare in the Korean war but kept mum about it. However, the south Korean authorities are zealously patronizing the U.S. Their behavior only brings to light their true colors as faithful colonial servants of the U.S. 
					
					 Ulterior motive of the puppet regime in hurling malignant mud at the DPRK and treating the wounds of his master is to pleasure his master. In order to prolong their remaining days the puppet gangsters are going so reckless as to deny the germ warfare perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists during the last Korean war though it was banned worldwide and to slander compatriots. This is touching off bitter resentment of the service personnel and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 They are leveling their guns at the gangster-like U.S. imperialists keen to bring down its social system and dignity.
					
					 Once an order is issued, the Korean People's Army will deal an unimaginable, merciless deadly blow at the U.S. mainland fated to meet a final doom.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities should not run riot, properly understanding the situation. If they persist in the reckless confrontation with fellow countrymen as a faithful dog of the U.S. despite our warnings, it will precipitate their disgraceful ruin.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan's Hysteria for Reinvasion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan's Hysteria for Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Japan launched a military spy satellite on Feb. 1. The Japanese authorities openly claim it is aimed to get military information to cope with "missile threats" from the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary says this is a trick to justify its ambitious design for becoming a military giant.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that Japan's military provocation is timed to coincide with the U.S. racket for escalating confrontation with the DPRK that has been intensified from the outset of the year, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan has always sought to fish in troubled waters on the Korean peninsula whose situation is inching close to a war. It has got its desired benefits at the beck and call of U.S. master. The DPRK is made the primary target of Japan's strike. 
					
					 Military espionage activities that can be seen only on the eve of a war are being openly intensified. This is an indication that the Japanese reactionaries' invasion of the DPRK is on the horizon.
					
					Japan, however, is dreaming a wild dream.
					
					 Gone are the days never to return when Japan could grab and dominate the land of other country in a brigandish way.
					
					 Those aggressors intruding into the inviolable territory of the DPRK and those servants offering their territory as bases and providing war supplies will not be able to escape the fate of forlorn wandering spirit.
					
					 Japan has to cool its head over-heated with hysteria for reinvasion, before it is too late.

articles.title: Germ Warfare Waged by U.S. during Korean War (1)
articles.content:
Germ Warfare Waged by U.S. during Korean War (1)
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. waged a germ warfare during the 1950-1953 Korean War in flagrant violation of international laws and regulations.
					 According to confidential documents of the puppet Syngman Rhee's "government" the Korean People's Army seized after liberating Seoul, the U.S. secretly pushed ahead with preparations for a germ warfare before invading the DPRK and a large number of germ weapons was produced in Japan, as ordered by MacArthur, commander of the U.S. Forces in the Far East.
					
					 As regards the germ warfare launched by the U.S., TASS of the Soviet Union disclosed that the U.S. army built some 10 prisons and used many Korean patriots as guinea-pigs in experiments on biological weapons. 
					
					 At that time, it had been also reported that the U.S. produced 16 kinds of germ weapons and tested them against POWs in Koje Island.
					
					 In January 1952, two American airmen were brought down to be captured when dropping germ bombs in the area of Anju. They confessed that the U.S. government had planned from long ago to wage a germ warfare in the Korean war, made full preparations for it and used germ weapons in an organized manner. They said they received intensive trainings on germ warfare from August 1951.
					
					 The germ warfare planned and waged by the U.S. cannibals was a heinous inhuman crime aiming at massacring the Korean nation from A to Z.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea North-targeted Military Drill Staged
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea North-targeted Military Drill Staged
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the marine corps of the south Korean puppet army staged a north-targeted joint military drill on Kanghwa Island on Feb. 10, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The warmongers staged a drill of destroying targets and escaping after secretly intruding into an operation area simulating the one of the DPRK by use of rubber boats and swimming. 
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet marine corps are mulling staging Ssangyong drill for joint landing operation in Phohang area of North Kyongsang Province late in March.

articles.title: French Organization Denounces Revival of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea
articles.content:
French Organization Denounces Revival of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association posted an article on its website on January 30 to condemn the the south Korean authorities for intensifying the fascist dictatorship.
					 The article said:
					
					 The south Korean authorities forcibly dismissed the Unified Progressive Party while running counter to democracy and are waging a farce for the retrogressive revision of the "Security Law" to stamp out the progressive and democratic forces.
					
					 The SL is a vestige of the past fascist dictatorship regime.
					
					 The invocation of the fascist law has been further encouraged in south Korea under the patronage of the present south Korean chief executive.
					
					 The world human rights organizations denounce the south Korean SL as an obstacle in the way of realizing democracy.
					
					 People of various circles of south Korea are conducting the struggle against Park Geun Hye.
					
					 The article cited facts to prove that suppression of organizations standing for reunification and patriotism and the progressive and democratic forces is being frantically waged in south Korea, stressing that the reality shows that Park is reviving "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Human Rights Abuses Unabated in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Human Rights Abuses Unabated in S. Korean Puppet Army
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Human rights abuses are unabated in the south Korean puppet army.
					 According to south Korean Yonhap News, a sergeant of a unit of the army in Rinje, south Korean Kangwon Province on Feb. 5 assaulted a private for the mere reason that he did not carry out his duty properly, and then committed sexual abuse against him.

articles.title: Sexual Abuses Shielded in S. Korean Military
articles.content:
Sexual Abuses Shielded in S. Korean Military 
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- There occurred another shocking sexual abuse in the south Korean puppet army, sparking off public uproar.
					 According to KBS of south Korea on Feb. 5, as regards the disclosed fact that an army colonel habitually committed sexual abuses against a service woman under his command, the commander of the First Corps let loose reckless remarks shifting the blame for the sexual abuses onto the victim. 
					
					 At a meeting of major commanding officers of the Ground Force of the puppet army the commander patronized the criminal by questioning "Why did not the service women clearly express their unwillingness if they displeased to do any service?" 
					
					 He insulted the victims far from making an apology for the sexual abuse in the unit under his command and severely punishing the criminal. This clearly shows what alarming phase the immorality and corruption in the upper echelon of the puppet army has reached.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by German Organization on Its Internet Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by German Organization on Its Internet Homepage
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Bring About Innovations in Agricultural Production under the Unfurled Banner of the Socialist Rural Theses" was posted by the  Anti－Imperialist Forum of Germany on its internet homepage on Feb 6. 
					 The work is the letter sent by him to the participants in the national conference of subworkteam leaders in the agricultural sector on February 6, Juche 103 (2014). 
					
					 The work deals with big changes brought about in the socialist rural construction in the DPRK since the publication of the Theses on the Socialist Rural Question (Feb. 25, 1964). It indicates the tasks and ways for finally settling the rural question.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Thai, Indian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Thai, Indian Figures
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the feats of leader Kim Jong Il took place in Thailand and India on Feb. 3 on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (his birth anniversary).
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand praised Kim Jong Il as tender-hearted father of the people who dedicated his all to them.
					
					 The chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association noted that Kim Jong Il put the DPRK on the status of a political, ideological and military power, placing the Korean people's dignity and honor on the highest level.
					
					 The chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Kim Jong Il's Works said:
					
					 Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK Kim Jong Il performed immortal feats for the cause of socialism.
					
					 The greatest feat performed by him for the cause of socialism was that he saved the destiny of socialism.
					
					 He paid primary efforts to bolstering up the defence capabilities, thus frustrating the imperialists' offensive to stifle the DPRK and protecting the destiny of the country and the nation during the most difficult days.
					
					 His feats for the cause of socialism will always be remembered by progressives.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Image Will Be Kept in Hearts of Progressives: Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Image Will Be Kept in Hearts of Progressives: Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Mongolian paper UB Post on Feb. 2 dedicated one whole page to a special write-up with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Mt. Paektu and Kim Jong Il" praised the peerless great man who was born as the son of the guerrillas on Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of the revolution, and made an immortal contribution to the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence with his distinguished political ability, matchless courage and pluck.
					
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on Feb. 3 carried various articles under the headline of "Kim Jong Il, great master of independent politics" illustrated with his photo. 
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission" noted that his feats will be glorified forever along with the eternal prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on Feb. 3 ran an article titled "Life for future".
					
					  The paper said that Kim Jong Il dedicated his all to the bright future of the country and the people.
					
					 It was his aim and worth to do work for the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people, the paper noted, adding:
					
					 His image will be kept forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also progressives.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Studied in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Studied in Germany
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting for explaining the New Year address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un took place at the meeting room of the Communist Party of Germany on Jan. 31.
					 The participants in the meeting were briefed on the part of Korea's reunification in the New Year address. Then followed speeches.
					
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, and other speakers quoted Kim Jong Un's address as saying we think it is possible to resume the suspended high-level contacts and hold sectoral talks if the south Korean authorities are sincere in their stand towards improving inter-Korean relations through dialogue and there is no reason why we should not hold a summit meeting if the atmosphere and environment for it are created. They praised this as an important historic proposal.
					
					 They urged the south Korean authorities to accept the proposal without fail.
					
					 The chief criminals straining the situation on the Korean peninsula are the U.S. who is resorting to the reckless nuclear and "human rights" rackets and the south Korean authorities yielding to outside forces with their rifle turned on the compatriots, they noted.
					
					 The Communist Party of Germany fully supports the New Year Address made by Kim Jong Un and will invariably encourage the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their struggle for achieving the country's reunification, they stressed.

articles.title: Foreign Figures Praise Kim Jong Il as Peerless Patriot
articles.content:
Foreign Figures Praise Kim Jong Il as Peerless Patriot
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks, lecture and film show took place in Iran, Guinea, Nigeria and the Czech Republic from Feb. 1 to 4 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The vice-general secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran said that Kim Jong Il was the peerless patriot who dedicated his whole life to the happiness of the people and the prosperity of the country. He developed in depth the Juche idea founded by President Km Il Sung, defended the country's sovereignty and dignity with original Songun politics and turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power, the vice-general secretary noted, adding:
					
					 The Korean people are successfully materializing the idea and cause of the preceding leaders under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I hope that the Korean people would gain greater success in the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The chief of Construction Site No. 2 in a district of Conakry City, Guinea in a lecture said that Kim Jong Il's noble life will remain forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also progressives.
					
					 The director of a company of Nigeria at the show of Korean film "Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification" noted that Kim Jong Il formulated the three charters for national reunification and made a distinguished contribution to the Korean people's struggle for the country's reunification.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Khabarovsk, Russia
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Khabarovsk, Russia
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) and the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed by the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on February 5.
					 Alexandr Gromov, first secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including round-table talks and film show praising and introducing the sacred revolutionary career and immortal feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in DR Congo
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) and the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Kinshasa, DR Congo on February 4.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including meeting, photo exhibition and film show from February 5 and April 15.

articles.title: Figure of DR Congo Vow to Glorify Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism
articles.content:
Figure of DR Congo Vow to Glorify Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism
 Pyongyang, February 10 (KCNA) -- We will further glorify the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the  National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo, said this at an inaugural ceremony of the preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) and the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) held in DR Congo on Feb. 4.
					
					 He continued:
					
					  Today we formed the preparatory committee to significantly celebrate the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star in boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They will always be alive in hearts of not only the Korean people but also the progressives for their immortal feats.
					
					 It is our sacred obligation to hold for all ages in high esteem Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who founded and developed in depth the guiding idea of mankind and to embody the Juche idea in the reality of DR Congo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam desea exitos en los trabajos del presidente irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam desea exitos en los trabajos del presidente irani
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 10 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani, con motivo del 36o aniversario del triunfo de la revolucion islamica de Iran.
					El remitente expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises en desarrollo favorable se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en todos los dominios como la politica, la economia y la cultura y deseo de todo corazon mayores exitos en los trabajos del mandatario y el pueblo de Iran para defender la soberania y dignidad del pais y lograr el desarrollo socioeconomico.

articles.title: Iniciado ciclo de cine por el Dia de Estrella Luz
articles.content:
Iniciado ciclo de cine por el Dia de Estrella Luz
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciado el ciclo de cine en celebracion del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					En ese lapso se proyectaran en los cines y casas culturales en la capital y otras localidades "!Corea, te hare grande!", "Estrella Luz del Paektu", "Brilla, pico Jong Il" y otras peliculas documentales que recopilan la historia revolucionaria y las proezas del Dirigente.
					
					Tambien se llevaran a la pantalla las peliculas de ficcion como "Hasta el fin de este mundo", "Deseo", "Linea de vida", "Oleada de Songgang" y "Casa pequena en la linea avanzada". 
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la ceremonia de inauguracion 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra de apertura, el ministro de Cultura, Pak Chun Nam dijo que para el Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos, que en la nueva centuria del Juche marchan a pasos firmes hacia la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Songun, las indelebles proezas del Dirigente sirven de tesoros incomparables con nada y base de eterna duracion para la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad de las generaciones venideras. 
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes vieron la pelicula "Gracias a tener al gran general insigne" (tomo 22).
					
					Este dia, se inicio el ciclo de cine en todas las provincias.

articles.title: Iniciada exposicion nacional de bellas artes por Dia de Estrella Luz
articles.content:
Iniciada exposicion nacional de bellas artes por Dia de Estrella Luz 
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada la Exposicion Nacional de Bellas Artes en celebracion del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					En la parte central de la galeria acondicionada en el Museo de Bellas Artes de Corea se ve una obra de bellas artes que describe al Dirigente encontrandose en la cima del monte Paektu.
					
					Ademas, estan exhibidas las obras pictoricas que reflejan la vida revolucionaria y los nobles rasgos de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu y muestran el aspecto de lucha de los militares y civiles coreanos que logran meritos en la defensa del socialismo y en la construccion de un Estado prospero. 
					
					Entre ellas figuran la pintura al estilo coreano "Fiesta de febrero en visperas de la liberacion de la patria", la acrilica "Estrella Luz del monte Paektu", etc.
					
					La ceremonia de apertura tuvo lugar este martes en el Museo de Bellas Artes de Corea con la participacion de Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, los funcionarios interesados, los creados de bellas artes, trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes de la capital.
					
					El ministro de Cultura, Pak Chun Nam, pronuncio la palabra de apertura.

articles.title: Otorgado premio a exitos cientificos y personas ameritadas
articles.content:
Otorgado premio a exitos cientificos y personas ameritadas
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, fue otorgado el Premio de Ciencia y Tecnica 16 de Febrero a los exitos cientificos, que contribuiran a la construccion de la potencia economica y la mejora de vida poblacional, y a las personas ameritados.
					Ese premio es conocido como la maxima distincion en el sector cientifico-tecnico.
					
					Fue otorgado el premio a los exitos cientificos entre otros el sistema de educacion a larga distancia "Risang", bomba para el calor de mil kilovatios y locomotora electrica asincronica.
					
					Recibieron el premio mas de 180 cientificos, tecnicos, profesores, investigadores y funcionarios, inclusive Kim Il Nam, rector del Instituto Superior de Educacion a Larga Distancia adscrito a la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, Pak Son Hui, investigadora de la Filial de Industria Ligera de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias y Won Ung, ingeniero-jefe del Complejo de Locomotoras Electricas Kim Jong Thae, etc.
					
					La ceremonia de premiacion tuvo lugar el dia 10 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo.

articles.title: Igor Sagitov ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Igor Sagitov ofrece banquete
Pyongyang, 10 de febrero (ACNC) -- El encargado de negocios a.i. de la Federacion Rusa en Corea, Igor Sagitov ofrecio el dia 10 un banquete con motivo del dia de los funcionarios diplomaticos de Rusia.
					Fueron invitados a la comida el vicecanciller coreano Kung Sok Ung, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia, Kim Jin Bom, los funcionarios interesados, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en Corea y miembros de las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada de la Federacion Rusa en Corea.
